item.title: File Exploration in Vim
item.description: Vim is a great text editor. There’s a plethora of third party plugins to extend vim and help navigate file systems and also a heap of ways to use them. I’m not sure, if it’s common knowledge that vim has very nifty tricks up its sleeve for to tackle exploring the directory structures without additional plugins and opening up remote files using your beloved vim configuration. That is, if you are inclined to heavily configure your vim with or without plugins, then all that sweetness can be applied to editing files remotely instead of having to use some remote machine’s vanilla vim.
